Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; faded added white bands at top of sherd; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of body, shoulder, neck and forelegs of possible hound leaping to right (added red patches on shoulder and neck; row of dots on underbelly).
Curator's comments: Lemos suggests that the animal depicted on the sherd may be a boar. Dots on the underbelly are usually seen on sphinxes, lions, rams, hounds, goats and deer. Although the physical features on the sherd most closely resemble a hound, they are very rarely depicted on vessels in the Mature Animal Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 258, no. 486)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0500) (phase 2)
